message: Pod coredns-ff8999cc5-bzx4n has added capabilities in container coredns.
status_detail: Pod coredns-ff8999cc5-bzx4n has added capabilities in container coredns.

unmapped.notes: Exceptions for adding capabilities should be explicitly defined and monitored.

finding_info.desc: This check ensures that Kubernetes clusters are configured to minimize the admission of containers with capabilities assigned beyond the default set, mitigating the risks of container breakout attacks.
finding_info.title: Minimize the admission of containers with added capabilities

remediation.desc: Restrict the addition of extra capabilities to containers through admission control policies.

risk_details: Allowing containers with additional capabilities increases the risk of security breaches and container breakout attacks.

finding_info.desc: This check ensures that Kubernetes clusters are configured to minimize the admission of containers with Linux capabilities assigned, adhering to the principle of least privilege and reducing the risk of privilege escalation.
finding_info.title: Minimize the admission of containers with capabilities assigned

remediation.desc: Restrict the assignment of Linux capabilities to containers unless essential for their operation.

risk_details: Assigning unnecessary Linux capabilities to containers increases the risk of privilege escalation and security breaches.

message: Pod node-agent-xdlsw is using hostPID.
status_detail: Pod node-agent-xdlsw is using hostPID.

unmapped.notes: Exceptions for hostPID containers should be clearly defined and monitored.

finding_info.desc: This check ensures that Kubernetes clusters are configured to minimize the admission of containers that share the host's process ID namespace. Containers with hostPID can inspect and interact with processes outside of the container, potentially leading to privilege escalation.
finding_info.title: Minimize the admission of containers wishing to share the host process ID namespace

remediation.desc: Restrict the use of hostPID in containers through admission control policies.

risk_details: Allowing containers to share the host's PID namespace without strict control can lead to security risks and potential privilege escalations.

message: Pod node-agent-xdlsw is running as root user in container node-agent.
status_detail: Pod node-agent-xdlsw is running as root user in container node-agent.

unmapped.notes: Exceptions for root containers should be clearly defined and monitored.

finding_info.desc: This check ensures that Kubernetes clusters are configured to minimize the admission of containers running as the root user. Running containers as root increases the risk of container breakout and should be restricted.
finding_info.title: Minimize the admission of root containers

remediation.desc: Restrict the use of root containers through admission control policies.

risk_details: Allowing containers to run as root can lead to elevated risk of security breaches and container breakout.

message: Pod ksa-aggregator-79fbc948cf-txk77 does not have docker/default seccomp profile enabled at both pod and container levels.
status_detail: Pod ksa-aggregator-79fbc948cf-txk77 does not have docker/default seccomp profile enabled at both pod and container levels.

unmapped.notes: The docker/default seccomp profile may need to be adjusted if it's too restrictive for certain applications.

finding_info.desc: This check verifies that the docker/default seccomp profile is enabled in pod definitions. Enabling seccomp profiles helps restrict the set of system calls applications can make, enhancing the security of workloads in the cluster.
finding_info.title: Ensure that the seccomp profile is set to docker/default in your pod definitions

remediation.desc: Implement the docker/default seccomp profile in pod definitions for enhanced container security.

risk_details: Not using or incorrectly configuring seccomp profiles can leave containers with broader permissions, increasing the risk of malicious actions.

message: Prowler is not being executed inside Node lima-rancher-desktop, please verify kubelet.conf file ownership manually.
status_detail: Prowler is not being executed inside Node lima-rancher-desktop, please verify kubelet.conf file ownership manually.

unmapped.notes: Regular checks of kubelet.conf file ownership are essential for maintaining node security.

finding_info.desc: Ensure that the kubelet.conf file, which is the kubeconfig file for the node, has its file ownership set to root:root. This check verifies the proper ownership settings to maintain the security and integrity of the node's configuration.
finding_info.title: Ensure kubelet.conf file ownership is set to root:root

remediation.desc: Ensure kubelet.conf file ownership is correctly set to protect the node's configuration.

risk_details: Incorrect file ownership settings on kubelet.conf can lead to unauthorized access and potential security vulnerabilities.

message: Prowler is not being executed inside Node lima-rancher-desktop, please verify kubelet.conf file permissions manually.
status_detail: Prowler is not being executed inside Node lima-rancher-desktop, please verify kubelet.conf file permissions manually.

unmapped.notes: Regular checks of kubelet.conf file permissions are essential for maintaining node security.

finding_info.desc: Ensure that the kubelet.conf file, which is the kubeconfig file for the node, has permissions set to 600 or more restrictive. This ensures the integrity and security of the node's configuration.
finding_info.title: Ensure kubelet.conf file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive

remediation.desc: Ensure kubelet.conf file permissions are correctly set to protect the node's configuration.

risk_details: Improper permissions on kubelet.conf can expose sensitive configuration data, potentially leading to cluster security compromises.

message: Prowler is not being executed inside Node lima-rancher-desktop, please verify kubelet config.yaml file permissions manually.
status_detail: Prowler is not being executed inside Node lima-rancher-desktop, please verify kubelet config.yaml file permissions manually.

unmapped.notes: Regularly verify the file ownership of kubelet config files to ensure they are not altered unexpectedly.

finding_info.desc: Ensure that if the kubelet refers to a configuration file with the --config argument, that file is owned by root:root. The kubelet config file contains various critical parameters for the kubelet service on worker nodes, and its ownership should be strictly controlled.
finding_info.title: Validate kubelet config.yaml File Ownership

remediation.desc: Secure the kubelet configuration by enforcing strict file ownership.

risk_details: Improper file ownership on kubelet config.yaml can expose sensitive data or allow unauthorized modifications.

message: Prowler is not being executed inside Node lima-rancher-desktop, please verify kubelet config.yaml file permissions manually.
status_detail: Prowler is not being executed inside Node lima-rancher-desktop, please verify kubelet config.yaml file permissions manually.

unmapped.notes: Regularly verify the file permissions of kubelet config files to ensure they are not altered unexpectedly.

finding_info.desc: Ensure that if the kubelet refers to a configuration file with the --config argument, that file has permissions of 600 or more restrictive. The kubelet config file contains various critical parameters for the kubelet service on worker nodes, and its permissions should be strictly controlled.
finding_info.title: Validate kubelet config.yaml File Permissions

remediation.desc: Secure the kubelet configuration by enforcing strict file permissions.

risk_details: Improper file permissions on kubelet config.yaml can expose sensitive data or allow unauthorized modifications.

message: Prowler is not being executed inside Node lima-rancher-desktop, please verify Kubelet service file ownership manually.
status_detail: Prowler is not being executed inside Node lima-rancher-desktop, please verify Kubelet service file ownership manually.

unmapped.notes: Regular checks for file ownership can prevent unauthorized changes.

finding_info.desc: This check ensures that the kubelet service file on each Node is owned by root. Proper file ownership is critical for the security and integrity of the kubelet service configuration.
finding_info.title: Ensure that the kubelet service file ownership is set to root:root

remediation.desc: Set the kubelet service file ownership to root:root to maintain its integrity.

risk_details: Incorrect ownership settings can lead to unauthorized modifications, potentially compromising the security and functionality of the kubelet service.

message: Prowler is not being executed inside Node lima-rancher-desktop, please verify Kubelet service file permissions manually.
status_detail: Prowler is not being executed inside Node lima-rancher-desktop, please verify Kubelet service file permissions manually.

unmapped.notes: The file location may vary based on the Kubernetes installation and should be verified for each cluster.

finding_info.desc: This check ensures that the kubelet service file on worker nodes has permissions set to 600 or more restrictive, limiting the file's write access to only system administrators. This measure is crucial to maintain the integrity and security of the kubelet service configuration.
finding_info.title: Ensure that the kubelet service file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive

remediation.desc: Ensure the kubelet service file is securely configured with restrictive permissions.

risk_details: Improper file permissions on the kubelet service file could lead to unauthorized modifications, compromising node security and stability.

message: Cluster Role Binding cluster-admin uses cluster-admin role.
status_detail: Cluster Role Binding cluster-admin uses cluster-admin role.

unmapped.notes: Modifying ClusterRoleBindings should be done with caution to avoid unintended access issues. Always ensure that critical system components have the necessary permissions to operate effectively.

finding_info.desc: This check ensures that the 'cluster-admin' role, which provides wide-ranging powers, is used only where necessary. The 'cluster-admin' role grants super-user access to perform any action on any resource, including all namespaces. It should be applied cautiously to avoid excessive privileges.
finding_info.title: Ensure that the cluster-admin role is only used where required

remediation.desc: Audit and assess the use of 'cluster-admin' role in all ClusterRoleBindings. Ensure it is assigned only to subjects that require such extensive privileges. Consider using more restrictive roles wherever possible.

risk_details: Inappropriate use of the 'cluster-admin' role can lead to excessive privileges, increasing the risk of malicious actions and potentially impacting the cluster's security posture.

message: User or group 'kube-apiserver' has access to the node proxy sub-resource.
status_detail: User or group 'kube-apiserver' has access to the node proxy sub-resource.

unmapped.notes: Carefully evaluate which users or service accounts require the ability to access the proxy sub-resource of node objects.

finding_info.desc: This check ensures that access to the proxy sub-resource of node objects is restricted. Access to this sub-resource can grant privileges to use the Kubelet API directly, bypassing Kubernetes API controls like audit logging and admission control, potentially leading to privilege escalation.
finding_info.title: Minimize access to the proxy sub-resource of nodes

remediation.desc: Restrict access to the proxy sub-resource of node objects in the cluster.

risk_details: Unauthorized access to the proxy sub-resource of node objects can lead to significant security vulnerabilities, including privilege escalation.

message: ClusterRole admin has pod create access.
status_detail: ClusterRole admin has pod create access.

unmapped.notes: Care should be taken to ensure that restrictions do not disrupt normal operations of the cluster.

finding_info.desc: This check ensures that the ability to create pods in a Kubernetes cluster is restricted to a minimal group of users. Limiting pod creation access mitigates the risk of privilege escalation and exposure of sensitive data.
finding_info.title: Minimize access to create pods

remediation.desc: Restrict pod creation access to minimize security risks.

risk_details: Unrestricted access to create pods can lead to potential security risks and privilege escalation within the cluster.

message: User or group 'system:kube-controller-manager' has access to create service account tokens.
status_detail: User or group 'system:kube-controller-manager' has access to create service account tokens.

unmapped.notes: Consider using role-based access control to precisely define and manage permissions related to service account token creation.

finding_info.desc: This check ensures that access to create new service account tokens is restricted within the Kubernetes cluster. Unrestricted token creation can lead to privilege escalation and persistent unauthorized access to the cluster.
finding_info.title: Minimize access to the service account token creation

remediation.desc: Restrict access to service account token creation in the cluster.

risk_details: Granting excessive permissions for service account token creation can lead to abuse and compromise of cluster security.

message: ClusterRole cluster-admin uses wildcards.
status_detail: ClusterRole cluster-admin uses wildcards.

unmapped.notes: Care should be taken to ensure that replacing wildcards does not disrupt normal operations of the cluster.

finding_info.desc: This check ensures that Roles and ClusterRoles in Kubernetes minimize the use of wildcards. Restricting wildcards enhances security by enforcing the principle of least privilege, ensuring users have only the access required for their role.
finding_info.title: Minimize wildcard use in Roles and ClusterRoles

remediation.desc: Replace wildcards in roles and clusterroles with specific permissions.

risk_details: Use of wildcards can lead to excessive rights being granted, potentially allowing users to access or modify resources beyond their scope of responsibility.
